text.p: Morgan Stanley & Co Inc said Tuesday it maintained its outperform rating for Brazilian state oil firm Petrobras, but raised its price target and cash earnings estimates for the firm.
-- Morgan Stanley analysts Hillary Peruzzi and Lloyd Byrne said in a report that Petrobras stock increased 80 percent in dollar terms since November versus 46 percent for the MSCI Brazil index.

-- "We believe Petrobras can continue to outperform because the stock still looks attractively valued and it represents a goodplay on the fundamental shift that is occurring in the Brazilian oil and gas industry," they wrote.
-- The analysts raised their price target to $290 per 1,000 shares from $230 and boosted their forecast for cash earnings per 1,000 shares to $40 in 1997 from $38 and to $44 in 1998 from $42.
-- They cited higher-than-expected cash earnings from the December 1996 refined products price increase.
-- "Although Petrobras stock is not as blatantly inexpensive versus its global peers as it was earlier this year, valuation remains attractive," they wrote.
-- The stock looks even more attractive when one considers that planned deregulation of Brazil's oil sector.
-- Petrobras preferred was up 0.4 percent at 250.99 reais and its common was 0.47 percent higher at 213 reais at 1242 local/1542 gmt in Sao Paulo.
